result.execSummary:
The defendant Vanessa Ann Desiderio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Subpoena for K.G.

Count 1: Guilty
Count 2: Guilty
Count 3: Guilty
Exhibit List - Exh #1 & #10
Sentencing hearing on September 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.
copy of subpoena for Jamie Thomas appd 7/26/17

8:32 AM Case called. Defendant Vanessa Ann Desiderio in court with attorney T. Gregory Amann.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court shows no pre-trial motions. Atty Amann addresses ourt. Court: Attys to stand to introduce themselves and give witness names. State makes oral motion re criminal history. 
Atty Amann objects, makes argument. State makes argument.  Court addresses parties.   One prior conviction allowed.  State requests  Atty Amann to not bring in DEF's version of case in voir dire or opening statements unless DEF is  testifying. Court  addresses parties. State argues motion. Atty Amann argues motion. State continues argument. Atty Amann continues argument. Court addresses  parties. Gives instuction to Atty Amann. Denies State's motion. Atty Amann questions whether State is uing video recording of interview. State: no. 8:57 am Recess

Baliffs: WJ and DL. Clerked by SJ-
9:05  Court calls case and recites appearances - clerk swears in all jurors. Court addresses jurors, introduces himself and thanks for appearing. Introduces Attorney's - State recites potential witness - Atty Amann recites defendant and potential witness.  Court further addresses jurors and sets record.
9:10   Court Voir Dire: 606 questioned - 210 questioned - 242 questioned - 934 questioned 9:21 side bar with attnys, voir dire resumes 934 excused 805 called - 805 questioned - 1149 questioned - 128 questioned - 357 questioned.
9:32 State voir dire 
9:40 Attny Amann Voir Dire, recites additonal potential witness - 805 questioned - 336 questioned - 248 questioned - 128 questioned - 630 questioned - 357 questioned - 606 questioned - 740 questioned - 1149 questioned - 811 palmer - 210 questioned - 312 questioned - 847 questioned - 807 questioned - 440 questioned 
9:48  Peremptory Challenge beings
9:56 Court calls selected jurors - dismisses unselected to the bank of the courtroom
9:59 Clerk swears in jurors - court excuses unselected jurors and thanks them for their time and service.
10:00 Court address the jurors and instructs on duties as a juror. 10 minute recess 10:02
10:17 On the record outside presence of the jury - jury brought in
10:18 Court addresses jurors, instructs as to opening statements
10:19 State opening statement
10:23 Attny Amann opening Statement
10:25 jurors stand down, on the record outside of the jury.  Address notepads on day 1.
10:26 Jury returns, instructs jurors as to no note taking during a 1 day trial. 
10:28 State calls K.J.G.   - sworn by clerk - examined by DA Poquette. Atty Amann objects to witnesses in courtroom. Requests sequester or removal. State has no objection. Court requests potential witnesses to wait in hallway. Direct continues. 
10:47 State offers as exhibit 1 - copy of witness statement. Direct continues. State moves for exhibit 1 to be received, DE no obj, accepted. State requests witness to read statement, DE objects.
10:48 sidebar. Direct continues. Witness reads statement
10:51  Cross-examined by atty Amann. 
11:01 Court excuses K.J.G.
11:02 State calls J.T. Sworn by clerk, examnied by DA Poquette. 
11:08 Atty Amann addresses concern of witness paying attention to K.J.G.  Court addresses. Direct continues.  
11:15 State presents exhibit #2, J.T. witness statement, state offers exhibit, Atty Amann objects.  Jury stands down. 
11:16 on the record outside of the jury, court address sidebar.  
11:16 Atty Amann objects to exhibit 2 being read based on it being consistant and being hear-say.  State withdraws admission of exhibit #2. Court addresses counsel. 5 minute recess 11:19.
11:29 On the record outside the presence of the jury, jury returns.
11:30 Direct by state continues of witness J.T.
11:31 Cross-examined by Atty Amann.
11:35 State objects, argumentative.  Court directs to rephrase. Cross continues.
11:37 Court excuses  J.T.
11:38 State rests, no more witnesses
11:39 DE calls Investigator H. Bearheart. Sworn by clerk. Examined by Atty Amann. 
11:44 cross-examined by DA Poquette. 
11:47 Atty Amann argues speculative, Court sustains argument.  Cross continues.
11:48 Atty Amann redirects. No recross from state.
11:49 Court excuses Investigator H. Bearheart
11:50 Court addresses jurors, will stand down for lunch until 1:15 so that court can address counsel at 1:00. 
11:52 On the record outside the presence of the jury.  Court addresses atty Amann regarding DE testimony and jury instruction after lunch.
11:53 Recess for lunch.
1:18 PM  Back on the record outside the presence of the jury, for Jury instructions. 
   Jury instructions for theft. Definition of theft with special facts. Jury instruction will not include valuation.  Take out paragraph in 12. Leave paragraph regarding DE testimony in. Modify 484 page 20 verdict verbiage, change to 6 vs 4. Also include if the property of theft was a firearm. Atty Amann adresses 3rd count and the itemization of property stolen. Court will leave count 3 as is.
1:27 Off the record.
1:33 Back on the record outside the presence of the jury - changes made as to jury instructions.  Court addresses Desiderio on her right to testify or not to testify. Court finds DE understands her right to testify or not testify and will testify. 
1:36 Atty Amann would like offer exhibit 10 to use video interview in court as evidence.  State adresses length of entirety or video being problematic, also video has not been offered and entered. Atty Amann wants to play part that would impeach Inv. Bearheart's statement, video section 3:34 to 3:59.  State would like the entirety up to 3:59. 
1:43 Off the record to review video.
1:45 Back on the record outside the presence of the jury - Court addresses the video. State objects to video based on the inability to hear the DE. Court will allow the brief portion of the video. 
1:49 Jury returns - Court addresses the Jury 
1:50 Atty Amanns offers exhibit #10, CD with video clip of interview with DE and Inv. Bearheart. Court receives exhibit #10. 
1:53 DE calls C.R.H. Sworn by clerk. Examined by Atty Amann.  1:56 State objects, court asks to restate question.  Direct continues.
1:58 Cross-examined by DA Poquette.  Atty Amann objects to questionning of prior addresses. Court allows. Cross continues. 
2:01 Court excuses C.R.H.
2:02 DE Calls V. Desiderio.  Sworn by clerk.  Examined by Atty Amann 
2:10 Cross-examined by DA Poquette
2:13 Court excuses V. Desiderio
2:13 Defense rests
2:14 No further from DA Poquette, Jury stands down.
2:15 On the record outside of the presence of the jury, Court asks atty's to review final Jury instructions and verdict forms. Atty Amann page 19 states 2 counts, should be 3. Court will make the adjustment.  Short break.
2:30 Back on the record outside the presence of the jury. Jury returns. Court recites jury instructions.
2:47 State makes Closing arguments
2:58 Atty Amann makes Closing arguments
3:00 State objects to Atty Amann stating his opinion on the DE's character.  Court asks Atty Amann to stay away from this type of statement.
3:08 State rebuttal, Atty Amann objects to statement of what happens in every care. Court directs DA Poquette to avoid and continue with rebuttal.
3:14 Court gives final instructions and verdict forms
3:18 Clerk swears in baliffs
3:18 Jury stands down for deliberations
3:19 On the record outside of the presence of the jury - Court Addresses attorney's   - exhibits will not be going to the jury room
3:20 Recess to await verdict
3:52 On the record outside of the presence of the jury - Jury returns with a verdict -  630 is foreperson - verdict tendered to bailiff - tendered to court
       Court:  Count 1 - Guilty - property was a firearm
                   Count 2 - Guilty - property was a firearm
                   Count 3 - Guilty
         Foreman agrees with reading of verdicts, Atty Amann requests individual poll, Court polls Jurors individually. All Yes in agreeance with verdict.
3:57 Court thanks jurors for their service, jurors are excused. 
4:00 Outside presence of Jury - Court accepts the verdicts - Count 1 Guilty, Count 2 Guilty, Count 3 Guuilty
4:01 State adresses the court.  Atty Amann address no concern with setting the SEH for a later date. State adresses the court.  SEH set for 9/12 at 8:30-9.
Bond will continue
4:06 PM Adjourned.

Defendant Vanessa Ann Desiderio in court with attorney T. Gregory Amann.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim is in court.

DEF does not know if needs tape or not. DEF will not make an objection to continuance.
Court: no other alternative to a continuance. State agrees with court that continuance is required.
